author: marioevz

author: pdobacz
content:
Question to `execution-spec-tests` - to format, lint and check source and tests I used to do
```
black tests && flake8 tests && isort tests && mypy tests
black src && flake8 src && isort src && mypy src && pytest -c ./pytest-framework.ini ...
```
since `ruff`, this doesn't seem to work. What is the replacement (I'm after commandline one-liners, not vscode). Thank you üôÇ

author: samwilsn
content: `uv run ruff format` if I were to take a guess?

author: marioevz
content: Exactly, and also `uv run ruff check` is the other one that the CI runs

author: pdobacz
content: oook, I was missing the `uv` (tox.ini leaves it out) and also an `uv sync --all-extras` before and somehow got stuck. Thx

author: marioevz
content: Hey <@543900561460822016> <@758579010027782144> <@583892532644151312> <@827653956955406406> <@508125616940515329>, we have the PR to add the blob scheduling to the state and blockchain fixtures, and Pawel raised a good point. Do we want to generate tests where the blob schedule deviates from mainnet and test that the client follows these modified values? Please some input would be appreciated: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/1040#issuecomment-2605608168

author: jochembrouwer
content: Hmm first Q would there be any impact of the blob schedule on state tests? These only contain one tx, right? I could only see the one thing which could be tested there is the correct calculation of blob gas price from the environment excess blob gas?

author: jochembrouwer
content:
The question if we want to test changing the blob schedule params raises also some questions for me, what was actually the original idea of these values? (EIP-7840). I had the idea that this was intended for simple configs for future forks where we want to change the max/target blob gas.

My initial thought here would be that it would be nice, but it is not strictly necessary since we want to test the mainnet fork here. Obviously if similar networks want to fork but with different params it would definitely be a requirement to add these tests. 

(Will think about this a bit more and then reply on the GH PR also)

author: marioevz
content: For state tests, it only affects for the rejection of transactions exceeding the maximum amount of blobs, which would not be the best of tests because that would be better off as a blockchain test

author: jochembrouwer
content: Ah right, forgot the ability of state tests to check for rejected txs, was more thinking along the lines of block-per-block interaction or per-tx interaction (max X blobs per block). But yeah good point the max blobs could be tested in state tests as well
